results.title: What Was That Badge Herschel Walker Flashed in His Debate?

results.title: The Rent Revolution Is Coming
results.abstract: For the 44 million households who rent a home or apartment in the U.S., inflation keeps pushing costs higher and higher. Anger is rising too. It could be a breaking point.

media.caption: Tiana Caldwell, a co-founder and Board President of KC Tenants, outside the East Patrol Division Station in Kansas City after being arrested during the group's disruption of a city council vote on a new set of housing ordinances.

results.title: ‘Coffins Are Already Coming’: The Toll of Russia’s Chaotic Draft
results.abstract: Newly mobilized recruits are already at the front in Ukraine, a growing chorus of reports says, fighting and dying after only days of training.

results.title: Inmate Stole $11 Million in Gold Coin Scheme While in Prison, Officials Say
results.abstract: A Georgia inmate used a contraband phone to impersonate a billionaire, secured more than 6,000 gold coins and then arranged to buy a multimillion-dollar house, according to court records.

media.caption: Capt. Dwain Williams checking on a prisoner at the Georgia Diagnostic and Classification Prison in 2015. Officials say an inmate there, Arthur Lee Cofield, used a contraband phone to impersonate a billionaire and steal $11 million.
